meta.name: description
meta.content: Navasota Independent School District, in partnership with students, parents, and community members, dedicates its efforts to creating a passion for excellence. As a multi-cultural, professional community, the district provides equitable experiences for students to participate in a rigorous curriculum using the latest technology in quality facilities. With stability from the past and a vision for the future, students are prepared to excel in a progressive and changing world.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Navasota Navasota ISD NISD school K-12 Navasota Schools

div.p: Navasota ISD encompasses 362 sq. mi. and is located in the southern part of Grimes County. Teachers and staff are highly dedicated to caring for & educating all 3056 students. The citizens of the NISD take great pride in the quality of their schools.

h3.a: "I love the family atmosphere between administration and staff. I love working with my students and they love learning.

div.div: Rocky Whitely, Algebra, Statistics and Risk Management Teacher at Navasota High School

h3.a: My favorite part of working at Navasota ISD is the small town atmosphere of the district. I love how everyone knows one another and that education is personal.

div.div: Kristi Ramsey, Associate Principal at Navasota High School

h3.a: My favorite part of working at Navasota ISD is THE PEOPLE! The relationships that Ive built with students and friendships that have been formed with colleagues are still vibrant today.

div.div: So it is THE PEOPLE, for years and years, who have made every day special for me at Navasota ISD. Once a Rattler...Always a Rattler!" Nancy Bouliane, Librarian at Navasota High School.

img.alt: Navasota ISD Spring Grading Guidelines Featured Photo

div.div: Navasota ISD Administrators and Principals worked together to develop guidelines for handling grades during the time of remote learning due to COVID-19. Grading guidelines for Spring 2020 are available by clicking the title.

img.alt: MONICA GUERRERO NAMED NAVASOTA JUNIOR HIGH PRINCIPAL Featured Photo

h3.a: MONICA GUERRERO NAMED NAVASOTA JUNIOR HIGH PRINCIPAL

div.div:
Monica Guerrero started her career in education 21 years ago. She earned a Bachelor of Science degree in 1999 from Sam Houston State University and went on to obtain a Masters degree in Instructional Technology from Sam Houston State University in 2012. Her first teaching position was in 8th grade language arts at Navasota ISD in 1999. She then went on to teach 7th grade language arts and technology applications. She spent 17 years as a classroom teacher at Navasota Junior High.
In 2016 she obtained a principal certification from Lamar University and took on the role of assistant principal at Navasota Junior High School. Mrs. Guerrero and her husband, Artie Guerrero, have a daughter, Arabella (11).
Monica brings a passion for building relationships with students and their families. She works collaboratively with others and believes in a team approach to learning. She is looking forward to leading Navasota Junior High and strengthening the belief that all students can grow and learn.
"I am honored to be named as the junior high school principal. Navasota Junior High has become a part of my family. I value the staff and students and all they have to offer. I have high expectations, and I am excited to see our students achieve academically. I am blessed to have a job that I love and I look forward to this great opportunity, said Mrs. Guerrero.
We are proud to make the announcement of Mrs. Monica Guerrero as our junior high school principal. Mrs. Guerrero has shown through her efforts and results, her commitment to Navasota ISD, our students, and our community as we continue to strive for excellence in every area. She is excited about this opportunity and we look forward to continued growth and opportunities for Navasota Jr. High and Navasota ISD. said Dr. Stu Musick, Superintendent of Schools. We are very appreciative of the entire Jr. High staff and especially the interview committee for the outstanding job that they did throughout the search process over the past several months. Their time and input was incredibly valuable. The lengthy process helped to solidify and confirm that Ms. Guerrero is the right person to help lead our Jr. High campus to the next levels that we expect.

img.alt: A MESSAGE FROM OUR NAVASOTA ISD BOARD OF TRUSTEES Featured Photo

h3.a: A MESSAGE FROM OUR NAVASOTA ISD BOARD OF TRUSTEES

div.div:
The Navasota I.S.D. Board of Trustees would like to let all of our students, parents, teachers, staff, administration and community know how grateful we are for all of your patience, understanding and hard work during this time. As Dr. Musick stated on Friday, "We will get through this unprecedented time stronger and together." Rest assured that we will continue to be here to support you.#WeAreNavasota
Our Board of Trustee web page which can be found under the "Department" tab has the recording of the April 20 meeting.

img.alt: Navasota ISD to Close for Remainder of School Year Featured Photo

h3.a: Navasota ISD to Close for Remainder of School Year

div.div:
Rattler Family,
This afternoon, Governor Abbott informed local school districts that he has made the decision to close all schools for the remainder of this 2019-2020 school year. Based on this declaration by the governor, Navasota ISD students will not return to campus this school year, but we will continue to serve meals and provide learning to all our students through the end of May.
We will continue to serve Grab and Go meals at both Webb Elementary and High Point Elementary through this closure on weekdays from 10:00 am - 12 noon.
Navasota ISD will continue to provide both high-tech online learning and low-tech paper based options for instruction and learning will continue until the end of May.
Due to this executive order by the governor, we are announcing that we will postpone our May 29 graduation. Our hope is that we will be able to reschedule our Class of 2020 graduation, later this summer, if and when this crisis ends. We will continue to meet as an administrative team to develop plans for course credits, grades, and other questions that may arise during our closure. As additional plans are developed we will share that information with students, parents, staff, and our community. We will get through this unprecedented time stronger and together. Please stay safe and continue to follow our website and Facebook page for the latest information.
Dr. Stu Musick Superintendent of Schools Navasota ISD
